article.headline: Lipscomb 55, Belmont 50
article.story: NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) -- Eddie Ard scored 17 points and Lipscomb pulled away in the second half for a 55-50 win Friday night over Belmont. Lipscomb (11-7, 5-2 Atlantic Sun Conference) trailed 25-24 at the half but rallied to go ahead 45-33 and then held off a late charge by the host Bruins (12-6, 6-1). Lipscomb led 51-40 with 1:15 left before Belmont made the final score seem closer than the game really was. The Bisons hit 16-of-29 free throws to Belmont's 5-of-8. Trey Williams was the only other Lipscomb player in double figures, with 10. Ard also had a game-high eight rebounds. Belmont had just one player in double figures, Henry Harris with 13, including a 3-pointer with a minute left during the Bruins' late rally. Lipscomb shot just 36.7 percent from the floor while Belmont hit 38 percent. The game was a rematch of last season's Atlantic Sun Tournament title game in Johnson City, won by Belmont. The Nashville matchup is called the "Battle of the Boulevard" because the two schools are just a couple of miles apart on the same road.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
